t: Psalm 38
Prayer in Time of Chastening
A Psalm of David. To bring to remembrance.
O*pn Lord,*s do not rebuke me in Your wrath, Nor*ld chasten me in Your hot displeasure!
For*ld Your arrows pierce me deeply, And*ld Your hand presses me down.
There*iln is*i no soundness in my flesh Because*ld of Your anger, Nor*ld any*i health in my bones Because*ld of my sin.
For*ld my iniquities have gone over my head; Like*ld a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
My*ld wounds are foul and*i festering Because*ld of my foolishness.
I*ln am troubled, I am bowed down greatly; I*ld go mourning all the day long.
For*ld my loins are full of inflammation, And*ld there*i is*i no soundness in my flesh.
I*ld am feeble and severely broken; I*ld groan because of the turmoil of my heart.
Lord,*ln all my desire is*i before You; And*ld my sighing is not hidden from You.
My*ld heart pants, my strength fails me; As*ld for the light of my eyes, it also has gone from me.
My*ln loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my plague, And*ld my relatives stand afar off.
Those*ld also who seek my life lay snares for*i me;*i Those*ld who seek my hurt speak of destruction, And*ld plan deception all the day long.
But*ln I, like a deaf man,*i do not hear; And*ld I*i am*i like a mute who*i does not open his mouth.
Thus*ld I am like a man who does not hear, And*ld in whose mouth is*i no response.
For*ln in You, O Lord,*s I hope; You*ld will hear, O Lord my God.
For*ld I said, “Hear*i me,*i lest they rejoice over me, Lest,*ld when my foot slips, they exalt themselves*i against me.”
For*ln I am*i ready to fall, And*ld my sorrow is*i continually before me.
For*ld I will declare my iniquity; I*ld will be in anguish over my sin.
But*ld my enemies are*i vigorous, and*i they are strong; And*ld those who hate me wrongfully have multiplied.
Those*ld also who render evil for good, They*ld are my adversaries, because I follow what*i is*i good.
Do*ln not forsake me, O Lord;*s O*ld my God, be not far from me!
Make*ld haste to help me, O*ld Lord, my salvation!
